FifoChat

class babydragon.chat.memory_chat.FifoChat[source]

Bases: FifoThread, Chat

A chatbot class that combines FIFO Memory Thread, BaseChat, and Prompter. The oldest messages are removed first when reaching the max_memory limit. The memory is defined in terms of tokens, and outs are passed to the longterm_memory. The lucid_memory is a redundant memory that stores all the messages.

Parameters:

  • model (str | None) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • system_prompt (str | None) –

  • user_prompt (str | None) –

  • name (str) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

  • max_fifo_memory (int) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

  • longterm_thread (BaseThread | None) –

__init__(model=None, index_dict=None, system_prompt=None, user_prompt=None, name='fifo_memory', max_index_memory=400, max_fifo_memory=2048, max_output_tokens=1000, longterm_thread=None)[source]

Initialize the BaseThread instance.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the memory thread. Defaults to ‘memory’.

  • max_memory – The maximum number of tokens allowed in the memory thread. Defaults to None, which means no limit.

  • tokenizer – The tokenizer to be used for tokenizing messages. Defaults to None, which means using the tiktoken encoding for the ‘gpt-3.5-turbo’ model.

  • model (str | None) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • system_prompt (str | None) –

  • user_prompt (str | None) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

  • max_fifo_memory (int) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

  • longterm_thread (BaseThread | None) –

fifo_memory_prompt(message)[source]

Compose the prompt for the chat-gpt API, including the system prompt and memory thread.

Parameters:

message (str) – A string representing the user message.

Returns:

A tuple containing a list of strings as the prompt and the marked question.

Return type:

Tuple[List[dict], dict]

query(question, verbose=True)[source]

Query the chatbot with a given question. The question is added to the memory, and the answer is returned and added to the memory.

Parameters:

  • question (str) – A string representing the user question.

  • verbose (bool) – A boolean indicating whether to display input and output messages as Markdown.

Returns:

A string representing the chatbot’s response.

Return type:

str

VectorChat

class babydragon.chat.memory_chat.VectorChat[source]

Bases: VectorThread, Chat

A chatbot class that combines Vector Memory Thread, BaseChat, and Prompter. Memory prompt is constructed by filling the memory with the k most similar messages to the question until the max prompt memory tokens are reached.

Parameters:

  • model (str | None) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • name (str) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

  • max_vector_memory (int) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

  • system_prompt (str) –

  • user_prompt (str) –

__init__(model=None, index_dict=None, name='vector_memory', max_index_memory=400, max_vector_memory=2048, max_output_tokens=1000, system_prompt=None, user_prompt=None)[source]

Initialize the BaseThread instance.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the memory thread. Defaults to ‘memory’.

  • max_memory – The maximum number of tokens allowed in the memory thread. Defaults to None, which means no limit.

  • tokenizer – The tokenizer to be used for tokenizing messages. Defaults to None, which means using the tiktoken encoding for the ‘gpt-3.5-turbo’ model.

  • model (str | None) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

Combine system prompt, k most similar messages to the question, and the user prompt.

weighted_memory_prompt(message, k=10, decay_factor=0.1, temporal_weight=0.5)[source]

Combine system prompt, weighted k most similar messages to the question, and the user prompt.

Parameters:

  • question – A string representing the user question.

  • k (int) – The number of most similar messages to include in the prompt.

  • decay_factor (float) – A float representing the decay factor for weighting.

  • temporal_weight (float) – A float representing the weight of the temporal aspect.

  • message (str) –

Returns:

A tuple containing a list of strings as the prompt and the marked question.

FifoVectorChat

class babydragon.chat.memory_chat.FifoVectorChat[source]

Bases: FifoThread, Chat

A chatbot class that combines FIFO Memory Thread, Vector Memory Thread, BaseChat, and Prompter. The memory prompt is constructed by including both FIFO memory and Vector memory.

Parameters:

  • model (str) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • system_prompt (str) –

  • user_prompt (str) –

  • name (str) –

  • max_memory (int) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

  • longterm_thread (VectorThread | None) –

  • longterm_frac (float) –

__init__(model=None, index_dict=None, system_prompt=None, user_prompt=None, name='fifo_vector_memory', max_memory=2048, max_index_memory=400, max_output_tokens=1000, longterm_thread=None, longterm_frac=0.5)[source]

Initialize the BaseThread instance.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the memory thread. Defaults to ‘memory’.

  • max_memory (int) – The maximum number of tokens allowed in the memory thread. Defaults to None, which means no limit.

  • tokenizer – The tokenizer to be used for tokenizing messages. Defaults to None, which means using the tiktoken encoding for the ‘gpt-3.5-turbo’ model.

  • model (str | None) –

  • index_dict (Dict[str, PandasIndex | MemoryIndex] | None) –

  • system_prompt (str | None) –

  • user_prompt (str | None) –

  • max_index_memory (int) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

  • longterm_thread (VectorThread | None) –

  • longterm_frac (float) –

setup_longterm_memory(longterm_thread, max_memory, longterm_frac)[source]

Set up long-term memory by allocating memory for the FIFO and Vector memory components.

Parameters:

  • longterm_thread (VectorThread | None) – An optional VectorThread for long-term memory.

  • max_memory (int) – The maximum amount of memory for the chatbot.

  • longterm_frac (float) – The fraction of memory dedicated to long-term memory.

fifovector_memory_prompt(message, k=10)[source]

Combine the system prompt, long-term memory (vector memory), short-term memory (FIFO memory), and the user prompt.

Parameters:

  • question – A string representing the user question.

  • k (int) – The number of most similar messages to include from the long-term memory.

  • message (str) –

Returns:

A tuple containing a list of strings as the prompt and the marked question.

Return type:

Tuple[List[dict], dict]
